ch.rs.reflectorgrid

Class ReflectorGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.rs.reflectorgrid.ReflectorGrid

  • public class ReflectorGrid
extends Object
    This class is used in conjunction with TransferGrid.java and enables a user to generate a GridPane with labels and TextFields/ComboBoxes/TextAreas for variables used in an Object. This also supports variables from inhereted classes, aswell as private variables. Please make sure you know the possibilities that @TransferGrid enables, before letting the end user change variables he is not supposed to.

    This class uses the JavaFX GridPane and due to the way it is built, you only need one class to generate a Grid. If the object changes to another object you want to show the Variables of, you can just call turnObjectIntoGrid() again. Due to the nature of JavaFX it will automaticly update the Grid on your GUI.

    Author:
    Ricardo Daniel Monteiro Simoes Autho of some nifty little tricks: I-Al-Istannen, : https://github.com/I-Al-Istannen

    • Method Detail

      • transfromIntoGrid

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane transfromIntoGrid(Object object)

      • redoGrid

        public void redoGrid()
        This Method can be used externally to regenerate the Grid. This is supposed to be used when you do Layoutchanges after generating the Grid.

      • addGridElements

        protected LabelDisplayOrder.InsertionPosition addGridElements(LabelDisplayOrder.InsertionPosition position,
                                                              javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridToAdd)
        This function takes the Nodes of a subObject and moves them to the main GridPane. Due to the nature of JavaFX we need to cast the subObject GridPane to a List.
        Parameters:
        position - The starting position for the positioning of the Nodes in the main GridPane
        gridToAdd - The GridPane of the subObject
        Returns:
        returns the position for the next node in the GridPane

      • setLabelDisplayOrder

        public void setLabelDisplayOrder(LabelDisplayOrder labelDisplayOrder)
        Sets the format for the grid.

        LabelDisplayOrder for information about the different avaliable formats.

        Parameters:
        labelDisplayOrder - the new labelDisplayOrder

      • setNodeWidthLimit

        public void setNodeWidthLimit(double limit)
        Manually set your own limit to how wide TextInputs can get. Standard is set to 300. This does not change the Width of an already generated Grid! You can call redoGrid() to regenerate the Grid!
        Parameters:
        limit - the max width to be use for the input fields.

      • setFieldNamingStrategy

        public void setFieldNamingStrategy(FieldNamingStrategy fieldNamingStrategy)
        Parameters:
        fieldNamingStrategy - The FieldNamingStrategy to use

        FieldNamingStrategy for information about the different avaliable strategies.
